alert.note: Alert for Henry; Jefferson; Louisa; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 29 at 10:57AM CDT until June 29 at 11:45AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Henry County in southeastern Iowa... Western Louisa County in southeastern Iowa... Southern Washington County in southeastern Iowa... Northeastern Jefferson County in southeastern Iowa... * Until 1145 AM CDT. * At 1057 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Coppock, or 11 miles south of Washington, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Noble around 1105 AM CDT. Olds and Swedesburg around 1110 AM CDT. Ainsworth and Crawfordsville around 1115 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Winfield, Cotter, Wyman, Columbus City, Marsh, Columbus Junction, Fredonia, Cairo, Louisa County Fairgrounds, Virginia Grove Recreation Area and Letts. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
